DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to describe radiation therapy administration in reference to location of disease (e.g. primary tumor or recurrence). [Manually-curated]

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: related to the position within the body (organ, structure or relative position where therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light is given.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: use PHOTOTHERAPY, LASER THERAPY, or ULTRAVIOLET THERAPY for therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light, respectively.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

Property.preferredDefinition: Relating to anatomy.:A position, site, or point in space where something can be found.

Concepts.definition: A position, site, or point in space where something can be found.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: locations or structures in the human body.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._A position, site, or point in space where something can be found._Category; used informally to mean a class of things.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Far apart in space, time, or relevance from a point of reference.: The reemergence of a malignant neoplasm after a period of remission. -- 2003

Concepts.definition: Far apart in space from a point of origin on the body.
The reemergence of a malignant neoplasm after a period of remission.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.: A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.: The region in which a particular type of force can be observed, often viewed as a space which was modified by the sources of the force which the field represents.

Concepts.definition: Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.
The region in which a particular type of force can be observed, often viewed as a space which was modified by the sources of the force which the field represents.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Far apart in space, time, or relevance from a point of reference.: Named locations of, or within, the body.

Concepts.definition: Far apart in space from a point of origin on the body.
Named locations of or within the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Regional; limited to a particular location or area.: Named locations of, or within, the body.

Concepts.definition: Of or belonging to a broader area or region of the body.
Named locations of or within the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Of or belonging to a restricted area or locality.: The reemergence of a malignant neoplasm after a period of remission. -- 2003

Concepts.definition: Of or belonging to a restricted area or locality.
The reemergence of a malignant neoplasm after a period of remission.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Radiation Therapy Disease or Disorder Location Category
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: use PHOTOTHERAPY, LASER THERAPY, or ULTRAVIOLET THERAPY for therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light, respectively.:Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.:A position, site, or point in space where something can be found.:Category; used informally to mean a class of things.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
A position, site, or point in space where something can be found.
A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.
